results.title: The Rover
results.creator_credit: David Michôd, Liz Watts, David Linde, Cappi Ireland, Joel Edgerton, Josephine Ford, South Australian Film Corporation, Lava Bear Films, Blue-Tongue Films, Screen NSW, Screen Australia and Porchlight Films
results.brief_description: 10 years after a global economic collapse, a hardened loner pursues the men who stole his car through the lawless wasteland of the Australian outback, aided by the brother of one of the thieves.

constellations_other.name: True blue, true crime
constellations_other.description: Robert Connolly's The Dry is a recent Australian crime blockbuster, but the writer, director and producer's first film (and first crime film) connects to a longstanding tradition of true-blue crime stories from some of our greatest filmmakers.

results.creator_credit_for_label: David Michôd, Liz Watts, David Linde, Cappi Ireland, Joel Edgerton, Josephine Ford, South Australian Film Corporation, Lava Bear Films, Blue-Tongue Films, Screen NSW, Screen Australia and Porchlight Films

results.title: The Road
results.creator_credit: John Hillcoat, Margot Wilson, Joe Penhall, Steve Schwartz, Paula Mae Schwartz, Chris Kennedy, Nick Wechsler, Chockstone Pictures, Nick Wechsler Productions, 2929 Productions and Dimension Films
results.brief_description: An adaptation of Cormac McCarthy’s bleak apocalyptic novel starring Viggo Mortensen, Australian actor Kodi Smit-McPhee and Charlise Theron.

constellations_other.name: Outlaws and the end
constellations_other.description: Tracing connections from Sweet Country to Australian westerns and resistance to white colonial narratives.

results.creator_credit_for_label: John Hillcoat, Margot Wilson, Joe Penhall, Steve Schwartz, Paula Mae Schwartz, Chris Kennedy, Nick Wechsler, Chockstone Pictures, Nick Wechsler Productions, 2929 Productions and Dimension Films
results.description: A father and his son walk alone through burned America. Nothing moves in the ravaged landscape save the ash on the wind and water. It is cold enough to crack stones, and, when the snow falls it is gray. The sky is dark. Their destination is the warmer south, although they don’t know what, if anything, awaits them there.
description_for_label: A father and his son walk alone through burned America. Nothing moves in the ravaged landscape save the ash on the wind and water. It is cold enough to crack stones, and, when the snow falls it is gray. The sky is dark. Their destination is the warmer south, although they don’t know what, if anything, awaits them there.

results.title: The Queen in Australia
results.brief_description: In 1954, recently crowned Queen Elizabeth II and HRH the Duke of Edinburgh embarked on a two month tour of Australia.

constellations_other.name: Royalty, royalty, royalty
constellations_other.description: Fascination with the royal family has persisted over the years, as seen through newsreels, documentaries, films, TV shows, tabloid news and satire.

results.description: In 1954, recently crowned Queen Elizabeth II and HRH the Duke of Edinburgh embarked on a two month tour of Australia. It involved some 10,000 miles of travel by air and 4,000 miles by land and sea. The couple visited every state in the nation, and turned up at all sorts of events, from tennis at Kooyong to steel mills in Newcastle to woodchopping at Wagga to the Flying Doctor Service Service at Broken Hill. The film production arm of the federal government - the Film Division of the News and Information Bureau of the Department of the Interior - decided to cover the tour in 35mm colour film, sending the footage to England for processing and editing. Six weeks after the tour ended, the film was finished and became the first feature-length Australian film shot and financed by Australians in colour to be given a theatrical release.
description_for_label: In 1954, recently crowned Queen Elizabeth II and HRH the Duke of Edinburgh embarked on a two month tour of Australia. It involved some 10,000 miles of travel by air and 4,000 miles by land and sea. The couple visited every state in the nation, and turned up at all sorts of events, from tennis at Kooyong to steel mills in Newcastle to woodchopping at Wagga to the Flying Doctor Service Service at Broken Hill. The film production arm of the federal government - the Film Division of the News and Information Bureau of the Department of the Interior - decided to cover the tour in 35mm colour film, sending the footage to England for processing and editing. Six weeks after the tour ended, the film was finished and became the first feature-length Australian film shot and financed by Australians in colour to be given a theatrical release.

results.title: The Queen's Corgi
results.creator_credit: nWave Pictures, Belga Productions, Ben Stassen, John R. Smith, Rob Sprackling, Caroline Van Iseghem and Vincent Kesteloot
results.brief_description: When the Queen’s favourite dog, Rex, becomes lost, he must make new friends and embrace new adventures in order to find his way back to the palace.

constellations_other.name: Royalty, royalty, royalty
constellations_other.description: Fascination with the royal family has persisted over the years, as seen through newsreels, documentaries, films, TV shows, tabloid news and satire.

results.creator_credit_for_label: nWave Pictures, Belga Productions, Ben Stassen, John R. Smith, Rob Sprackling, Caroline Van Iseghem and Vincent Kesteloot
results.description: Since his arrival at Buckingham palace, Rex lives a life of luxury. Top dog, he has superseded his three fellow Corgis in Her Majesty’s heart. His arrogance can be quite irritating. When he causes a diplomatic incident during an official dinner with the President of the United States, he falls into disgrace. Betrayed by one of his peers, Rex becomes a stray dog in the streets of London. How can he redeem himself? In love, he will find the resources to surpass himself in the face of great danger…
description_for_label: Since his arrival at Buckingham palace, Rex lives a life of luxury. Top dog, he has superseded his three fellow Corgis in Her Majesty’s heart. His arrogance can be quite irritating. When he causes a diplomatic incident during an official dinner with the President of the United States, he falls into disgrace. Betrayed by one of his peers, Rex becomes a stray dog in the streets of London. How can he redeem himself? In love, he will find the resources to surpass himself in the face of great danger…

results.title: The Queen
results.creator_credit: BIM Distribuzione, Granada Productions, Scott Rudin Productions, Future Films, Pathé Pictures International, Pathé Renn Productions, Canal+, France 3 Cinéma, Consolata Boyle, Alan MacDonald, Andy Harries, Stephen Frears, Christine Langan, Peter Morgan and Tracey Seaward
results.headline_credit: France, Italy, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2006
results.brief_description: The Queen is an intimate behind the scenes glimpse at the interaction between HM Elizabeth II and Prime Minister Tony Blair during their struggle, following the death of Diana, to reach a compromise between what was a private tragedy for the Royal family and the public’s demand for an overt display of mourning.

constellations_other.name: Royalty, royalty, royalty

results.title: The Proposition
results.brief_description: Set in the Australian outback in the 1880s, the movie follows the series of events following the horrific rape and murder of the Hopkins family, allegedly committed by the infamous Burns brothers gang. Captain Morris Stanley captures Charlie Burns and gives him 9 days to kill his older dangerous psychopathic brother, or else they’ll hang his younger mentally slow brother on Christmas Day.

constellations_other.name: Outlaws and the end
constellations_other.description: Tracing connections from Sweet Country to Australian westerns and resistance to white colonial narratives.

results.title: The Princess Diaries
results.creator_credit: Gary Jones, Bottom of the Ninth Productions, Walt Disney Pictures, BrownHouse Productions, Mayne Berke, Garry Marshall, Whitney Houston, Mario Iscovich, Debra Martin Chase and Gina Wendkos
results.brief_description: A socially awkward but very bright 15-year-old girl being raised by a single mom discovers that she is the princess of a small European country because of the recent death of her long-absent father, who, unknown to her, was the crown prince of Genovia. She must make a choice between continuing the life of a San Francisco teen or stepping up to the throne.

constellations_other.name: Princesses, rom-coms and sit-coms
constellations_other.description: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field, but they were also used by film production companies and on TV shows, with some of those involved going on to define different genres.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Gary Jones, Bottom of the Ninth Productions, Walt Disney Pictures, BrownHouse Productions, Mayne Berke, Garry Marshall, Whitney Houston, Mario Iscovich, Debra Martin Chase and Gina Wendkos

She must make a choice between continuing the life of a San Francisco teen or stepping up to the throne.

results.title: The Post
results.creator_credit: Kristie Macosko, 20th Century Fox, DreamWorks Pictures, Reliance Entertainment, TSG Entertainment, Participant, Amblin Entertainment, Pascal Pictures, Star Thrower Entertainment, Ann Roth, Steven Spielberg, Rick Carter, Josh Singer, Kristie Macosko Krieger, Amy Pascal and Liz Hannah
results.brief_description: A cover-up that spanned four U.S. Presidents pushed the country’s first female newspaper publisher and a hard-driving editor to join an unprecedented battle between journalist and government. Inspired by true events.

constellations_other.name: Uncovering the truth
constellations_other.description: The images of Tank Man during the Tiananmen Square protests in 1989 were captured by photojournalists and shared around the world. The work of journalists has been key to uncovering abuses of power and are rich material for fictional and factual movies and TV.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Kristie Macosko, 20th Century Fox, DreamWorks Pictures, Reliance Entertainment, TSG Entertainment, Participant, Amblin Entertainment, Pascal Pictures, Star Thrower Entertainment, Ann Roth, Steven Spielberg, Rick Carter, Josh Singer, Kristie Macosko Krieger, Amy Pascal and Liz Hannah

results.title: The Philadelphia Story
results.creator_credit: Donald Ogden Stewart, George Cukor, Joseph L. Mankiewicz, Waldo Salt, Adrian, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Loew's Incorporated
results.brief_description: When a rich woman’s ex-husband and a tabloid-type reporter turn up just before her planned remarriage, she begins to learn the truth about herself.

constellations_other.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_other.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

results.title: The Phantom
results.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 1996
results.brief_description: The 21st successor to the role of Bengalla’s resident superhero must travel to New York to prevent a rich madman from obtaining three magic skulls that would give him the secret to ultimate power.

constellations_other.name: 1960s television
constellations_other.description: After its debut in the fifties, Australians rapidly became enthusiastic television viewers in the sixties as American imports started to be mixed with notable local productions.
